text: Césaire Rabenoro (27 August 1923 – 24 January 2002)https://www.rulers.org/indexr1.htmlProfile of Césaire Rabenoro was a Malagasy writer, teacher and politician. He served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Madagascar between 1991 and 1993 and the key person to Peace Corps Volunteers' first intervention to Madagascar. He also served as ambassador to the United Kingdom and to France. He wrote several books about external affairs, most notably "Les relations extérieures de Madagascar" published on May 3, 2000. He died on 24 January 2002, at the age of 78. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2002 deaths Category:Malagasy politicians Category:Foreign Ministers of Madagascar Category:Ambassadors of Madagascar to the United Kingdom Category:Ambassadors of Madagascar to France
title: Césaire Rabenoro
